varz.vars module¶

class varz.vars.Vars(dtype)[source]¶

Bases: plum.resolvable.Referentiable

Variable storage manager.

Parameters

dtype (data type) – Data type of the variables.

assign(name, value, differentiable=False)[source]¶

Assign a value to a variable.

Parameters

  • name (hashable) – Name of variable to assign value to.

  • value (tensor) – Value to assign.

  • differentiable (bool, optional) – Do a differentiable assignment.

Returns

Assignment result.

Return type

tensor

bnd(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Alias for vars.Vars.bounded().

bounded(init=None, lower=0.0001, upper=10000.0, shape=(), dtype=None, name=None)[source]¶

Get a bounded variable.

Parameters

  • init (tensor, optional) – Initialisation of the variable.

  • lower (tensor, optional) – Lower bound. Defaults to 1e-4.

  • upper (tensor, optional) – Upper bound. Defaults to 1e4.

  • shape (tuple[int], optional) – Shape of the variable. Defaults to scalar.

  • dtype (data type, optional) – Data type of the variable. Defaults to that of the storage.

  • name (hashable, optional) – Name of the variable.

Returns

Variable.

Return type

tensor

detach()[source]¶

Create a detached copy of the variable manager in PyTorch.

Returns

Detached copy.

Return type

vars.Vars

detach_vars()[source]¶

Detach all variables held in PyTorch.

get(init=None, shape=(), dtype=None, name=None)[source]¶

Get an unbounded variable.

Parameters

  • init (tensor, optional) – Initialisation of the variable.

  • shape (tuple[int], optional) – Shape of the variable. Defaults to scalar.

  • dtype (data type, optional) – Data type of the variable. Defaults to that of the storage.

  • name (str, optional) – Name of the variable.

Returns

Variable.

Return type

tensor

get_vars(*names, **kw_args)[source]¶

Get latent variables.

If no arguments are supplied, then all latent variables are retrieved. Furthermore, the same collection of variables is guaranteed to be returned in the same order.

Parameters

  • *names (hashable) – Get variables by name.

  • indices (bool, optional) – Get the indices of the variables instead. Defaults to False.

Returns

Matched latent variables or their indices, depending on the

value of indices.

Return type

list

get_vector(*names)[source]¶

Get all the latent variables stacked in a vector.

If no arguments are supplied, then all latent variables are retrieved.

Parameters

*names (hashable) – Get variables by name.

Returns

Vector consisting of all latent values

Return type

tensor

init(session)[source]¶

Initialise the variables.

Parameters

session (B.Session) – TensorFlow session.

pos(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Alias for vars.Vars.positive().

positive(init=None, shape=(), dtype=None, name=None)[source]¶

Get a positive variable.

Parameters

  • init (tensor, optional) – Initialisation of the variable.

  • shape (tuple[int], optional) – Shape of the variable. Defaults to scalar.

  • dtype (data type, optional) – Data type of the variable. Defaults to that of the storage.

  • name (str, optional) – Name of the variable.

Returns

Variable.

Return type

tensor

requires_grad(value, *names)[source]¶

Set which variables require a gradient in PyTorch.

Parameters

  • value (bool) – Require a gradient.

  • *names (hashable) – Specify variables by name.

set_vector(values, *names, **kw_args)[source]¶

Set all the latent variables by values from a vector.

If no arguments are supplied, then all latent variables are retrieved.

Parameters

  • values (tensor) – Vector to set the variables to.

  • *names (hashable) – Set variables by name.

  • differentiable (bool, optional) – Differentiable assignment. Defaults to False.

Returns

Assignment results.

Return type

list
